description: One of my favorite little deck builders. Plays fast and does everything I want a deck builder to do better than most deck builders.
One of my favourite deck builders for a long time. Still holds its own for such a simple deck builder. Spaceships!!!

title: Spouse: RE...
description: Spouse: REally like

title: Own the Ap...
description: Own the App only, but play pretty regularly.

title: I purchase...
description: I purchased this on the recommendation of fellow BGG-ers and man, I am THRILLED to have made this purchase. Tactical, strategic, a little cutthroat, and a whole lot of fun. This is my kind of game. The best part, it's less expensive than almost any game I've ever bought(purchased this for ~$10).

title: I purchase...
description: I purchased this on the recommendation of fellow BGG-ers and man, I am THRILLED to have made this purchase. Tactical, strategic, a little cutthroat, and a whole lot of fun. This is my kind of game. The best part, it's less expensive than almost any game I've ever bought(purchased this for ~$10).
Tight little deckbuilder that has expanded a lot over the years.  Have to be honest, the digital version adds a LOT of convenience reshuffling the deck so often, but this is a classic in either form.

title: One of the...
description: One of the simplest and best deck builders out there, solo play works great too, well worth the little money it is

title: One of the...
description: One of the simplest and best deck builders out there, solo play works great too, well worth the little money it is

title: Simple and...
description: Simple and fast two-player deck builder. A nice introduction to deck builders, with good art, a solid sci-fi theme and a little strategy. It's not deep, but that's fine.

title: the more I...
description: the more I play this, the more I like it. It is a deck builder with optional tableau building with the bases. The bases are the most genius part of the game.

title: This is mo...
description: This is more of the same trivial deck building, ascension style with random cards to buy each turn for each player.At least it's fast, but it's kind of meh, not much going on, and no soul.  In the end, I find out really kind of boring, and there isn't much in it that I would want to play it anymore.  I would play it if group decision dictated, but only because it's so fast, that it would be done quick.

title: Rating bas...
description: Rating based on 1st games, both live and on the app. Will proabably not be played much, so willing to trade this away and stick to the app instead.

title: Fills the ...
description: Fills the 2-player slot for me in a very nice way.  As a long-time Magic player, this hits all the right buttons for me, and all my friends agree.  A great filler game or one to just have around to play while waiting in line or for drinks to come.

title: An adversa...
description: An adversarial deckbuilder that distills the genre down to it's most basic elements.  Quick playing with just enough interesting decisions to be made in the short playtime.  A great 2-player filler, and my 10-year-old daughter likes to play it with me.

title: Top Tier Deckbuilding
description: A lot of folks are going to rate this game as average, but I think it deserves more credit than that.  Of the pure deck-building games I've played this one presents the best mix of simplistic numerical work and fun interactions. I'm happy to give this 4 stars because every time I’ve introduced it to someone they want to play a second round right after the first.

title: No Review Title
description: No Review Description

title: Very quick...
description: Very quick fun 2-player deck-builder. Great for travel.

title: Bought new...
description:
Bought new from someone at Geekway to the West.

What a tight little deckbuilding battle game. Would love to play this with 4. Short, only about 20-30 minutes (if you're really strategizing). Play the app all the time, and it's one of those games that I wouldn't hesitate to play tournament style.

title: What an am...
description: What an amazing game packed in a little box. Great artwork, great theme, tons of strategy, easy to teach and learn. Big bang for your buck.

title: Finally ha...
description: Finally have the card version but all the shuffling makes this a tough game physically for my wife. Play the app a ton though.

title: Two copies...
description: Two copies for four player. Rating for this (and its brothers) falling as more and more deckbuilders with a purpose (Clank!, Aeon's End, Tyrants of the Underdark) come out.

title: A very goo...
description: A very good distillation of some of the best aspects of the many also-rans in the deckbuilding genre. Not terribly big decision space, admittedly, but deckbuilding is so pleasing that it's hard to object too much.

title: Simply OK....
description: Simply OK. A 6 may be a bit generous for this title. Very little theme. Artwork is good and likely the best part about the game. It doesn't feel like playing a Sci-Fi game at all. Just a number cruncher, card optimization and luck of the draw. There are plenty of other games I would prefer to play over this. After thinking about it more, a 6 is probably much too generous. But only after 1 play I'll give it the benefit of the doubt.

title: Seems extr...
description: Seems extremely luck-dependent

description: Standard deckbuilder. It does exactly what it's trying to do: makes you feel like you're making progress. 'This turn I can buy 7 cards!'
